| Overview                = The House Champions are the best fighters representing each of the five Houses of the [[Five Weapons Society (Earth-616)|Five Weapons Society]].  The Champions are the successors to the [[Deadly Warriors (Earth-616)|Deadly Warriors]].  

| HistoryText             = 
===Origins===
After losing one of Society's Houses to Western invaders during the [[Boxer Rebellion]], [[Zheng Zu (Earth-616)|Zheng Zu]] relocated four of the five Houses outside of [[China]], with each House hosting scores of Warriors with the best one being named the Champion of their House. Five of Zheng Zu's children would be raised in each of the Houses, with each of them emerging as the Champion of their respective House.{{r|Shang-Chi Vol 1 3}}  

===Modern Era===
By the present day, the Society had devolved into a criminal empire bent on destroying the western world.  After discovering his father's evil nature, his son [[Shang-Chi (Earth-616)|Shang-Chi]] defected from the organization, embarking on a years long campaign to dismantle Zheng Zu's criminal empire, eventually resulting in Zu's death.  Unbeknownst to Shang-Chi, he was the designated Champion of the [[Fu Manchu's Fortress|House of the Deadly Hand]], which was left in shambles following his conflict with his father.{{r|Shang-Chi Vol 1 1}} 

After Zu's death, the title of Supreme Commander was passed onto his son, [[Brother Staff (Earth-616)|Brother Staff]], who shifted the Society's goals to monetary gain rather than conquest.  Staff's rule is challenged [[Zheng Shi-Hua (Earth-616)|Sister Hammer]], who usurps control from him following a duel to the death.  Even though Zheng Zu's [[Ghosts|spirit]] selects Shang-Chi as his successor, Hammer names herself as the new Supreme Commander, prompting the remaining Champions [[Brother Sabre (Takeshi) (Earth-616)|Brother Sabre]] and [[Sister Dagger (Esme) (Earth-616)|Sister Dagger]] to seek out Shang-Chi to reclaim his rightful place as the Society's legitimate ruler.{{r|Shang-Chi Vol 1 1}}

Following Sister Hammer's defeat and defection from the Society, Shang-Chi embraces his role as Champion, Brother Hand, and becomes the new Supreme Commander of the Society.{{r|Shang-Chi Vol 1 5}}  After discovering the existence of his exiled half-sister, [[Zheng Zhilan (Earth-616)|Zhilan]], Shang-Chi convinces her to rejoin the Society as the new Champion of the Deadly Staff.{{r|Shang-Chi Vol 2 3}}
